precautions: These foods and drinks are ideal for skin diseases; but foods which are sour, salty and pungent must be avoided.

precautions: Pinasa / Pratishyaya Chikitsa Things to avoid.
The patient should avoid baths, ablutions (with cold water), anger, sleeping for long hours and cold water.

In that of Kapha origin, the patient should fast (avoid food), the paste of gaurasarṣapaiḥ – Sinapis alba should be applied on the head, consume ghee mixed with alkali prepared of Hordeum vulgare and then vomit (by consuming emetic herbs); salt, Vyosa.
preparation_tips: Black pepper – Piper nigrum, Long pepper fruit – Piper longum and Ginger – Zingiber officinale, vella – Embelia ribes, vatsaka – Holarrhena antidysentirica and jīrakaiḥ – Cuminum cyminum should be macerated in goat’s urine and drops of this paste put into the nose.
Chorakadi Churna coraka – Angelica glauca, tarkārī – Premna integrifolia, vacā – Acorus calamus, ajāji – Cuminum cyminum and upakuñcikāḥ – Nigella sativa (made into powder) should be inhaled.

precautions: Stringent dietetic and lifestyle protocols followed sincerely will help keep away the disease.
